content.description: Go right and up on a trail that leads to an obvious crack.  It is V0 if hands only used in crack.
content.location:
It is up and right from

Broken In

.

content.description: Go up the right hand side of the boulder.  The crux is getting to the horn.  This is a short warm-up problem.
content.protection: It has a clean fall, but a pad is nice.
content.location: This is directly up the trail from the cairn.

content.description:
Start on

Berry Grazer

, and traverse left through the cave and finish standing on the ~4 foot tall boulder to the left. There are some good underclings on the left face of the cave. The back face of the cave is off, otherwise it's closer to a V1-. It is helpful to get higher than you think before entering the cave. This is a fun, little traverse!
content.location:
Start on

Berry Grazer

, 20 feet left of the main Raspberry Boulder.

content.description: This is a pretty sustained problem that eventually leads to Thank God holds up top.  It was given its name due to the fact that stuff kept breaking off and well, it broke into place. Good foot work makes this slightly less powerful.
content.location: Start on the right hand jug and left hand sidepull.  This problem is directly up the trail from the cairn.

content.description: Start on the two lowest jugs, and work your way up the spine staying centered on it as much as you can. Watch out for loose chunks, this isn't very clean yet. Pull to the ledge, and climb down to your right.
content.location: It is about 20 feet left of the main Raspberry Boulder.
